description: With this command the three basic security features of an account can be managed:
availability: All users have access to this command.

paramaters.Definition: The password which is currently set, must be stated if the existing password should be updated, i.e. if the parameter PASSWORD is stated

The OTP secret which should be used for the 2 factor authentication. Stating this parameter can have 3 different effects:If it is left empty the 2 factor authentication will be disabled if it was previously enabledIf 2 factor authentication is currently disabled and a valid OTP secret is stated 2 factor authentication will be enabledIf 2 factor authentication is enabled and a new OTP secret is stated the current OTP secret will be updated
The OTP which was created with the new OTP secret to be set. This is a required parameter if you want to update the current OTP secret or enable 2 factor authentaction

The OTP which was created with the OTP secret that is currently set. This parameter is required if 2 factor authentication is enabled for the account and you want to either set a new OTP secret or disable 2 factor authentication by setting an empty OTP secret
List of IP addresses from which the user is allowed to log in
